subject: Ants, Ants, everywhere!
msgSnippet: Hi, I am using Ant and I want to make sure that a mail server (Dixie) is running, before I run my JUnit tests.  I created a class, following the Ant guidelines
messageBody:
Hi,

I am using Ant and I want to make sure that a mail server (Dixie) is
running, before I run my JUnit tests. I created a class, following the
Ant guidelines and in the execute function, it throws a BuildException
if Dixie is not running (for now).

In my build.xml, I have these lines:

<taskdef name="dixiecheck" classname="dixiecheck.DixieCheck"/>

...

<target name="run.mail.server">
<dixiecheck/>
</target>

<target name="test" depends="compile.tests,run.mail.server"
if="junit.present"
description="Runs the JUnit test cases">
...

When I run Ant, without the mail server running, it displays my error
output that
indicates that the connection to the server failed, bu then it continues
on. What
do I need to do, to cause the build to stop, if the check fails?

Also, can anyone give me some ideas as to how to kick off the mail
server? It is
a Java app. I guess I could do a <java ...> line, but how do I make that
conditional?
Is there a way to set some "property", as a result of the "dixiecheck",
such that
this app would be invoked based on that "property" or "condition"?

Any suggestions would really help out...


PCM (Paul Michali)
